results.abstract: Scientists have long tried to duplicate the procedure that led to the first long-term remission 12 years ago. With the so-called London patient, they seem to have succeeded.

results.title: Ethiopian Airlines Plane Is the 2nd Boeing Max 8 to Crash in Months
results.abstract: The flight that killed all 157 people on board was en route from the Ethiopian capital to Nairobi, Kenya. It lost contact six minutes after take off, the airline said.

results.title: After India Loses Dogfight to Pakistan, Questions Arise About Its ‘Vintage’ Military
results.abstract: As America strengthens its alliance with India to help counter China, critics say its military faces serious challenges, from the age of its hardware to the size of its budget.

media.caption: Indian paramilitary troops in Srinagar in Kashmir this month. Sixty-eight percent of the army’s equipment is so old that it is officially considered “vintage.”

results.title: Google Finds It’s Underpaying Many Men as It Addresses Wage Equity
results.abstract: After a recent study, the company gave raises to thousands of men after determining they were earning less than women in similar jobs.

results.title: An Unvaccinated Boy Got Tetanus. His Oregon Hospital Stay: 57 Days and $800,000.
results.abstract: The boy’s harrowing experience with the disease in 2017 was the first pediatric case of tetanus in Oregon in more than 30 years, according to a new C.D.C. report.
org_facet: CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION

media.caption: A teenager getting a vaccine in Texas. An unvaccinated 6-year-old boy had the first pediatric case of tetanus in Oregon in more than 30 years. The state has one of the highest rates of unvaccinated residents in the country.
